# Descriptive Statistics

The **mean** is the average of the values in the variable

$$\overline{X}=\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^NX_i=\frac{X_1+X_2+...+X_{N-1}+X_N}{N}$$
In JASP click on the ‘Descriptives’ button and then click ‘Descriptive Statistics’

highlight the *extra* variable and click the ‘right arrow’ to move it across into the ‘Variables box'

# Descriptive Statistics

Here are the marks for 12 students enrolled in a statistics module 

```{r,comment=NA}
marks=read.csv("C:/Users/frana/OneDrive - Newcastle University/MODULES/ACE1040/Data/Marks.csv")
marks[1:12,1]
```

The mean of the marks is
```{r,comment=NA}
mean(marks[1:12,1])
```

The **median** is the middle value of a set of observations

The median is
```{r,comment=NA}
median(marks[1:12,1])
```


The **Mode** is very simple. It is the value that occurs most frequently. The mode for the data above is

```{r,comment=NA}
names(sort(-table(marks[1:12,1])))[1]
```
